params.nonce: a simple nonce, allowing more claims for one address

params.endId: the highest id to collect when this helix is active
params.price: the price of collect for this helix
params.signer: the signer address (for private sale helixes)
params.startId: the lowest token id to collect when this helix is active

params.contractURI_: The contract URI (containing its metadata) - can be empty ''
params.owner_: Address to whom transfer ownership (can be address(0), then owner is deployer)

returns._0: the URI where to find information about the module

owner().details: Returns the address of the current owner.

renounceOwnership().details: Leaves the contract without owner. It will not be possible to call `onlyOwner` functions anymore. Can only be called by the current owner. NOTE: Renouncing ownership will leave the contract without an owner, thereby removing any functionality that is only available to the owner.

royaltyInfo(address,uint256).details: Contrary to EIP2981, modules are expected to return basisPoint for second parameters      This in order to allow right royalties on marketplaces not supporting 2981 (like Rarible)

royaltyInfo(uint256).details: Contrary to EIP2981, modules are expected to return basisPoint for second parameters      This in order to allow right royalties on marketplaces not supporting 2981 (like Rarible)

params.newHelix: the new helix to mint from

params.endId: the highest id to collect when this helix is active
params.startId: the lowest token id to collect when this helix is active

supportsInterface(bytes4).details: Returns true if this contract implements the interface defined by `interfaceId`. See the corresponding https://eips.ethereum.org/EIPS/eip-165#how-interfaces-are-identified[EIP section] to learn more about how these ids are created. This function call must use less than 30 000 gas.

transferOwnership(address).details: Transfers ownership of the contract to a new account (`newOwner`). Can only be called by the current owner.

validateSignature(address,uint256,bytes).details: It ensures that _allowancesSigner signed a message containing (account, nonce, address(this))      and that this message was not already used

params.account: the account the allowance is associated to
params.nonce: the nonce associated to this allowance
params.signature: the signature by the allowance signer wallet

returns._0: the message to mark as used

collectActive().notice: if the collect of nfts is active or not

collectWithSignature(uint16,uint256,byte.notice: Collect with a signature (allows private sales)

contractURI().notice: returns an URI with information about the module

createMessage(address,uint256).notice: Helper that creates the message that signer needs to sign to allow a mint         this is usually also used when creating the allowances, to ensure "message"         is the same

createMessages(address[],uint256[]).notice: Helper that creates a list of messages that signer needs to sign to allow mintings

currentHelixId().notice: the current helix to mint from

getPrice(uint256).notice: Returns a token id price to collect (reverts if token id not in current helix or already collected)

gift(uint16,address).notice: Allows the owner of the contract to gift tokenId to recipient

onAttach().notice: Called by a Token Registry whenever the module is Attached

onDisable().notice: Called by a Token Registry whenever the module is Disabled

onEnable().notice: this contract doesn't really care if it's enabled or not         since trying to mint on a contract where it's not enabled will fail

setHelixIds(uint256,uint16,uint16).notice: Allows to change startId and endId of a helix

setHelixPrice(uint256,uint256).notice: Allows to change the price for a helix

setHelixSigner(uint256,address).notice: Allows to change the signer for a helix

setRoyaltiesRecipient(address).notice: Alows royaltiesRecipient or ower() to change theon-chain royalties recipient address

validateSignature(address,uint256,bytes).notice: This function verifies that the current request is valid
